node.title: Cars Wiki
node.data: Welcome to the Cars Wiki. Explore various car categories, models, manufacturers, and more.

node.title: Car Basics
node.data: A car is a vehicle used for transporting passengers. It usually has four wheels and an internal combustion engine.

node.title: Sedan
node.data: A sedan is a passenger car with a three-box configuration: engine, passenger, and cargo.

node.title: SUV
node.data: An SUV (Sport Utility Vehicle) is a larger vehicle that combines elements of road-going passenger cars with off-road vehicles.

node.title: Coupe
node.data: A coupe is a two-door car, typically sporty or luxurious, with a fixed roof and a more aggressive design.

node.title: Convertible
node.data: A convertible is a car with a roof structure that can be converted from closed to open, allowing for open-air driving.

node.title: Hatchback
node.data: A hatchback is a car with a rear door that swings upward, providing access to a trunk area.

node.title: Minivan
node.data: A minivan is a larger vehicle typically used for family transportation, offering spacious interiors and sliding doors.

node.title: Toyota
node.data: Toyota is a Japanese automobile manufacturer known for producing reliable and fuel-efficient vehicles.

node.title: Corolla
node.data: The Toyota Corolla is a compact car known for its affordability and reliability.

node.title: Camry
node.data: The Toyota Camry is a midsize sedan known for its smooth ride and longevity.

node.title: RAV4
node.data: The Toyota RAV4 is a compact crossover SUV offering a mix of practicality and versatility.

node.title: Ford
node.data: Ford is an American multinational automobile manufacturer known for its trucks, SUVs, and innovative models like the Mustang.

node.title: F-150
node.data: The Ford F-150 is a full-size pickup truck known for its toughness and strong towing capability.

node.title: Mustang
node.data: The Ford Mustang is an iconic American muscle car known for its powerful engines and performance.

node.title: Explorer
node.data: The Ford Explorer is a midsize SUV known for its family-friendly features and off-road capabilities.

node.title: BMW
node.data: BMW is a German luxury automobile manufacturer known for its precision engineering and performance-oriented vehicles.

node.title: 3 Series
node.data: The BMW 3 Series is a compact executive car known for its driving dynamics and luxury features.

node.title: X5
node.data: The BMW X5 is a luxury SUV combining spaciousness with sportiness.

node.title: M3
node.data: The BMW M3 is a high-performance variant of the 3 Series, known for its power and agility.

node.title: Car Parts
node.data: The engine is the heart of a car, converting fuel into mechanical energy to power the vehicle.

node.title: Engine
node.data: The engine is the heart of a car, converting fuel into mechanical energy to power the vehicle.

node.title: Transmission
node.data: The transmission is responsible for transferring power from the engine to the wheels, allowing the car to change speeds.

node.title: Brakes
node.data: The braking system allows a vehicle to slow down or stop by using friction to reduce speed.

node.title: Suspension
node.data: The suspension system includes springs, shock absorbers, and linkages that allow the vehicle to absorb bumps and vibrations from the road.

node.title: WheelsTires
node.data: Wheels are the circular parts that allow the car to move, while tires are rubberized coverings that provide grip and traction.

node.title: Invention of the Car
node.data: The automobile was invented by Karl Benz in 1886 with the creation of the Benz Patent-Motorwagen, widely regarded as the first true automobile.

node.title: Evolution of Cars
node.data: The car evolved over decades, with advancements in engine technology, safety features, and design. Key milestones include Henry Ford's Model T, the introduction of automatic transmissions, and the rise of electric vehicles.

node.title: The Rise of Electric Cars
node.data: Electric cars have gained popularity in recent years, with manufacturers like Tesla leading the charge. These cars use electric motors and batteries, reducing reliance on fossil fuels.

node.title: Autonomous Cars
node.data: Autonomous cars, or self-driving cars, use sensors, cameras, and AI to navigate without human intervention. Companies like Waymo and Tesla are leading in this field.

node.title: Hybrid Cars
node.data: Hybrid cars combine internal combustion engines with electric motors to improve fuel efficiency and reduce emissions.

node.title: Electric Cars
node.data: Electric vehicles (EVs) run entirely on electricity, offering a sustainable alternative to traditional gasoline-powered cars.

node.title: Airbags
node.data: Airbags are safety devices designed to inflate rapidly in the event of a collision to protect passengers from injury.

node.title: Anti-lock Braking System (ABS)
node.data: ABS helps prevent the wheels from locking during braking, improving vehicle control during emergencies.

node.title: Electronic Stability Control (ESC)
node.data: ESC helps prevent skidding by automatically applying brakes to individual wheels when it detects loss of traction.

node.title: Crash Test Ratings
node.data: Car manufacturers conduct crash tests to assess the safety of vehicles. Ratings from organizations like NHTSA and IIHS help consumers make informed decisions.

node.title: Tesla
node.data: Tesla is known for its electric vehicles, including the Model S, Model 3, Model X, and Model Y. The company has played a major role in pushing the adoption of electric cars.

node.title: Honda
node.data: Honda is a Japanese automaker known for producing reliable vehicles, including the Civic, Accord, and CR-V.

node.title: Chevrolet
node.data: Chevrolet is an American brand known for its trucks, SUVs, and popular cars like the Silverado and Malibu.
